qas.question: Why was the USAF forced to ground some of its squadrons in 2013?
Who was the Commander of Air Combat Command in 2013?
Why have many US Air Force pilots opted to resign from active service?

answers.text: squadron groundings and flight time reductions

qas.question: Where have many of these US Air Force pilots chosen to find employment instead?

context: Due to the <a0_0>Budget sequestration<a0_0/> in 2013, the USAF was forced to ground many of its squadrons. The Commander of Air Combat Command, <a1_0>General Mike Hostage<a1_0/> indicated that the USAF must reduce its F-15 and F-16 fleets and eliminate platforms like the A-10 in order to focus on a fifth-generation jet fighter future. In response to <a2_0>squadron groundings and flight time reductions<a2_0/>, many Air Force pilots have opted to resign from active duty and enter the Air Force Reserve and Air National Guard while pursuing <a3_0>careers in the commercial airlines<a3_0/> where they can find flight hours on more modern aircraft.
